alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:16PM CDT until May 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ROCK ISLAND...NORTHEASTERN MERCER...NORTH CENTRAL LOUISA...SOUTHERN CEDAR...WESTERN SCOTT...SOUTHEASTERN JOHNSON AND MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 607 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Rochester to near Muscatine to Sand Springs, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Muscatine and Sweetland Center around 610 PM CDT. Sunbury around 615 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Durant, Fairport, Illinois City, New Liberty, Fairport Recreation Area, Shady Creek Campground, New Era, Wildcat Den State Park, Eliza, Montpelier, Stockton, Loud Thunder Scout Camp, Loud Thunder Forest Preserve, Midway Beach, Clark`s Ferry Recreation Area, Andalusia, Mannon, Edgington, Petersville, Buffalo Shores, Marston, Pleasant Prairie, Plainview, Walcott, Blue Grass, Joy, Hamlet, Maysville, Millersburg, Reynolds, Taylor Ridge, West Lake Park, Davenport, Aledo, Buffalo, Mercer County Fairgrounds, Mississippi Valley Fairgrounds, Aledo Mercer County Airport, Gingle Corners and Davenport Municipal Airport. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
